name: Margaret Lewis
comments: Country music and rockabilly singer and songwriter from Texas

name: Nellie Monk

name: Anthony Brown
comments: Percussionist, composer, bandleader and educator based in California

name: Nino Rota
comments: Prolific and influential composer, pianist, arranger, conductor and academic, best known for his film scores, especially for Federico Fellini's films. Rota worked with, among others, Franco Zeffirelli, Luchino Visconti, Eduardo De Filippo and Francis Ford Coppola. Winner of the 1974 Academy Award for Best Original Score for "The Godfather Part II."

name: John Norum
comments: Norwegian-born hard rock and blues guitarist, singer and songwriter.

name: Phil Hurtt
comments: Philadelphia-born pianist, singer, songwriter, producer, and arranger

name: David Mengual

name: Subsonica
comments: Electronic rock band, formed in 1996 in Turin.

name: Verdena
comments: Indie pop trio.  The group's own songs are sung in Italian, but it does perform several covers of works written in English in that language,

name: Beatnik Filmstars
comments: Lo-fi pop group formed in Bristol

name: Janas Hoyt
aliases: Janas Hoyt and The Mary Janes

name: Angie
comments: Provided as a child backing vocals for the Buggles number one hit ''Video Killed The Radio Star''.

name: Keith Lentin
comments: Guitarist, bassist and producer, born in Cape Town, South Africa.

name: Lew Lewis
comments: Harmonica player, singer, and pub rock pioneer

name: Art Kassel
aliases: Art Kassel & His Kassels in the Air
Art Kassel and His Kassels in the Air – Vocal Refrain by Art Kassel
Art Kassel and His Kassels-in-the-Air – Vocal Refrain by Kassel Trio
comments: Dance bandleader and saxophonist. Kassel and his orchestra were staples of the Chicago music scene for 30 years before moving to Los Angeles in the late-1950s.

name: Jan Garber
aliases: Jan Garber and His Garber-Davis Orchestra
Jan Garber and His Greater Columbia Recording Orchestra
comments: Jazz and dance music bandleader. He started his first band, a quartet, in 1918, and played violin in it. During the 1920s he formed the Garber-Davis Orchestra in Atlanta with pianist Milton Davis playing mostly in the southern US. In 1927 he moved the band to Chicago and met Canadian bandleader and saxophonist Freddie Large. He took over Large's band, playing violin as leader, and played in Chicago and the midwest. While performing at the Trianon he received national attention when the shows were broadcast live over radio. An announcer called Garber "The Idol of the Airwaves".

name: Gary Richrath
comments: Guitarist, best known as lead guitarist and songwriter for the band REO Speedwagon from 1970 until 1989.

name: Self [US2]
comments: Pop punk band from Lexington, South Carolina, who were active from the early to mid 1990s

name: Tony Kofi
comments: Nottingham-born, London-based jazz saxophonist and flutist

name: Charles Tolliver
comments: Jazz trumpeter and composer, co-founder of Strata East Records.

name: Marcus Roberts
comments: Jazz pianist; Roberts has been blind since age 5.

name: The Epoxies
comments: New wave synth pop band from Portland, Oregon

name: Katey Sagal
comments: Best known for playing Peggy Bundy on US hit television sitcom "Married... with Children"

name: The Soul Stirrers
comments: Pioneer gospel music group, known for the innovative use of four men singing tight, light harmony plus a fifth as lead singer. With a career spanning over eighty years, it was a major influence on soul, doo wop, and Motown.

name: Jaret Reddick
comments: Singer-songwriter, musician, composer, and voice actor best known as the lead vocalist, rhythm guitarist, and primary songwriter for Bowling for Soup. He plays a guitar with a flag of Texas design.

name: One Night Stand [DE]
comments: House music duo - Kent Base, Martin Brandl

name: Stellar Kart
comments: Christian rock band from Phoenix, AZ

name: No for an Answer
comments: Hardcore band from Orange County, California

name: Dan O'Mahoney
comments: Musician, songwriter, writer, and political activist from Orange County, California.

name: Fred Foster
comments: Songwriter, record producer and co-founder of Monument . Foster helped launch the careers of Roy Orbison, Dolly Parton, Kris Kristofferson, Billy Joe Shaver, Billy Grammer, Jeannie Seely, Boots Randolph, Tony Joe White, Henson Cargill, Arthur Alexander, Larry Gatlin and The Gatlin Brothers and Robert Mitchum.  In addition he also produced Ray Price, Merle Haggard, Willie Nelson, Ray Stevens, Al Hirt, Billy Walker, Grandpa Jones, Joe Simon, Arthur Smith, Fran Jeffries, Ivory Joe Hunter and The Velvets. He was inducted into the Country Music Hall of Fame in 2016.

name: George Williams [US3]
comments: Soul singer and songwriter from Philadelphia

name: Roy Straigis
comments: Arranger, producer, songwriter and session musician

name: Cliff Bruner
aliases: Cliff Bruner and His Texas Wanderers
Cliff Bruner and His Texas Wonderers

name: The Ranch Boys
comments: Western singing trio formed in 1934 that worked mostly in radio.  In 1938 as a publicity stunt to show that they were real cowboys, the group rode on horseback from California to New York City -- a journey which took close to four months.  The group disbanded in 1941. The Ranch Boys were Ken "Shorty" Carson, Jack Ross and Joe "Curley" Bradley.

name: Jack Smith [US2]
comments: Vocalist, film actor, and television personality

name: Al Trace
aliases: Al Trace and His New Orchestra
Al Trace and His Orchestra - Vocal by Nick St. John
Al Trace and His Shuffling Rhythm Orchestra
Al Trace and His Silly Symphonists
comments: Songwriter and orchestra leader of the 1930s, 1940s and 1950s whose peak of popularity was reached in the Chicago area during the height of the Big Band era. He recorded for several record companies and composed over 300 songs, some alone and others as a collaborator, most frequently with his ten-years-older brother, Ben, while also writing a considerable number of songs using the pseudonyms Clem Watts or Bob Hart.

name: Billy May
aliases: Billy May and His Orchestra - Vocal by the Four Mayds
Billy May and His Orchestra - Vocal by The Maytimers

name: Brisa Roché
comments: Singer-songwriter born in Arcata, California, she has spent much of her life residing in France

name: Audrey Hepburn
comments: Actress, fashion icon, occasional singer, dancer and humanitarian

name: The Belmonts
comments: Doo-wop group, who named themselves after a Bronx street and scored nine Top 40 hits between 1958 and 1962 (with and without lead singer Dion

name: Orange [US2]
comments: Ethereal indie band influenced by Cocteau Twins

name: Márcia [FR]
comments: SInger and songwriter born in Paris

name: Vox Pop
comments: Punk band from Los Angeles and active around 1979-80.

name: Rocket Morgan
comments: Rock 'n' roll singer from Louisiana, active at the end of the 1950s and the early 1960s.

name: Howard Johnson [US3]
comments: Lyricist, inducted into the Songwriters Hall of Fame in 1970

name: Gerry Roslie
comments: Lead vocalist, keyboard player and songwriter in the garage rock band The Sonics.

name: Dead Moon
comments: Garage punk rock band, active from 1987 till 2006, formed in Portland, Oregon.

name: Fred Cole
comments: Rock singer, musician, composer, who played with several bands since the 1960s, most notably The Lollipop Shoppe, Dead Moon and Pierced Arrows.

name: The Customs [US]
comments: Short-lived punk rock band from Cincinnati, Ohio, that formed in the late 1970s and disbanded in 1981. Dubbed in 1979 in the Cincinnati Post as “the loudest, drunkest, most obnoxious Rock & Roll band in the city…fronted by a “singer” with the vocal ability of the local Greyhound bus dispatcher".

name: Futuristic Dragon
comments: Band created to record a T-Rex cover and taking its name from one of their songs.

name: Kenyon Hopkins
comments: Composer of film scores and music for television.  His work is notable for its use of jazz ideas in his orchestrations.  Hopkins also composed classical works and arranged and conducted for studio orchestra soundtrack and other recordings.

name: An April March
comments: Alternative rock band from Ontario. Not to be confused with the singer April March .

name: Halou
comments: Electronic/dream pop trio from San Francisco, Ca.

name: Brooke White
comments: Fifth place finalist on the seventh season (2008) of American Idol

comments: Singer and songwriter. Finalist on the 7th season of American Idol in 2008.

name: Ramiele Malubay
comments: Born in Saudi Arabia, but raised in the Philippines and USA.

personal_name: Crescenciano Abel Exaltación de la Cruz José de Jesús Mojica Montenegro y Chavarín
comments: Actor and singer. After retiring from show business he entered the Monastery of San Francisco, Lima, Peru and adopted the name of Fray Francisco José de Guadalupe Mojica.

aliases: Agustín Lara su piano y ritmos

Claude Luter son orchestre et son quartette

comments: Singer, songwriter and producer born in Teheran, Iran, from an Armenian family

name: GodboX
comments: Goth-rock musical project formed in 1997. The only constant member is singer/guitarist Luana.

name: Pete Rugolo
aliases: Pete Rugolo and His All Stars
comments: Jazz composer and arranger, though perhaps best known for his music for many US television programs in the 1960s and 1970s.  Rugolo was born in Sicily but emigrated to the United States with his family in 1920.

name: Buddy Morrow
aliases: Buddy Morrow and His "Night Train" Orchestra
Orchestra under the direction of Buddy Morrow
The Trombone of Buddy Morrow and His Orchestra

name: Jim Henson

name: 22 Brides

name: KMFDM
comments: Pioneers in the crossover between Techno/Dance/EBM electronics and heavy metal guitar samples. Born in Germany but then relocated to the USA

name: The Dictators
comments: Proto-punk band of the mid ’70s, eventually overshadowed by the likes of The Ramones, Talking Heads and Blondie who emerged from the same scene.

name: Bratmobile
comments: Punk / riot grrrl band founded in 1991 in Olympia, Washington

name: Spandau Ballet
comments: Synth-pop band, one of the most famous groups to emerge from the New Romantic movement in the early 1980's. They were also part of the so-called Second British Invasion, fueled by the US cable music channel MTV.

name: Leonard Feather
comments: British-born distinguished jazz music critic, pianist, producer, who was also a successful composer in the 1940s

name: Fred Fassert
comments: Songwriter from Bronx, New York. Eventually became a building inspector in New York.

name: Phil Spector
comments: Legendary and influential producer. Spector raised pop production's ambition by overdubbing scores of musicians to create a massive roar aka the "Wall of Sound". As a composer, he is co-credited for some of the biggest pop hits of the 1960s. In 1997, he was inducted into the Songwriters Hall of Fame.

name: Jeff Barry
comments: Songwriter, singer and record producer, inducted into the Songwriters Hall of Fame in 1991

name: Jimmy Page
comments: Rock musician, songwriter and record producer

name: Robby Krieger
comments: Spelled Robbie Krieger on various Doors releases

name: Magne Furuholmen
comments: Musician, songwriter and visual arts artist

name: Sol Marcus
comments: Composer born in New York City

name: Bennie Benjamin
comments: Benjamin started his career in the music business in vaudeville and began writing songs in 1940. He was inducted into the Songwriters Hall of Fame in 1984.

name: Barry Gibb
comments: Guitarist, vocalist and songwriter He was inducted into the Songwriters Hall of Fame in 1994 and into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame in 1997, as performer (Bee Gees).

name: Tom Kelly
comments: Singer-songwriter and musician who was inducted into the Songwriters Hall of Fame in 2011

name: Rudy Clark
comments: Songwriter from New York City active in the 1960s and 1970s

name: John Holt
comments: Arguably "Jamaica's probably most respected and beloved 'Lovers Rock' style singer" (Riddim Magazine 01/15)

name: Robert Smith [GB]
comments: Musician (guitar), singer, songwriter and producer, born in Blackpool, Lancashire, England. He's the only continuous member of the band The Cure which he co-founded in 1976.

name: Dale Bozzio
comments: Progressive rock and new wave vocalist. Currently goes by the name of Dale Bozzio-McKenzie, after marrying Richard McKenzie.

name: Johnny Marr
comments: English musician (guitar), singer and songwriter born in Ardwick, Manchester

name: Calvin Lewis
comments: Songwriter who grew up in Sheffield, Alabama. He was playing bass with a local band, the Esquires Combo, later joined by Percy Sledge.

name: Andrew Wright
comments: Songwriter from Alabama. Organist of the Esquires Combo.

name: Johnny Mercer
comments: Songwriter, lyricist, and vocalist. He is the Founding President of the Songwriters Hall of Fame, and inducted into it in 1971.

name: Bernie Taupin
comments: Lyricist, well known for his songwriting with Elton John. He was inducted into the Songwriters Hall of Fame in 1992. He and Elton John received the 2013 Johnny Mercer Award for their high quality of songwriting.

name: Rob Hyman
comments: Singer, songwriter, producer, arranger and recording studio owner

name: Henry Priestman
comments: Also a member of bands "It's Immaterial" and "Yachts".

name: LV
comments: R&B singer from Los Angeles, CA. Best known for singing the chorus on Coolio's 1995 hit single "Gangsta's Paradise". LV stands for "Large Variety".

name: José María Cano
comments: Musician, composer, conductor, record producer and visual artist

name: Björn Ulvaeus
comments: Guitarist, singer and one of the most successful co-songwriters ever. As of May 26, 2020, President of CISAC, the roof organization of copyright collecting societies.

name: Les Paul
comments: Jazz and country guitarist and songwriter. Paul was also instrumental in developing the hard body electric guitar, and was an innovator in recording techniques.

name: Jerry Leiber
comments: Songwriter and producer inducted into the Songwriters Hall of Fame in 1985

name: Mike Stoller
comments: Songwriter and producer inducted into the Songwriters Hall of Fame in 1985

name: Mark James [US1]
comments: Singer and songwriter, who was inducted in the Nashville Songwriters Hall of Fame in 2015.

name: Wayne Carson
comments: Born in Denver, Colorado, to Odie and Olivia Head, who played music professionally under the pseudonym Thompson. Hence his alias "Wayne Carson Thompson". Songwriter, country music multi-instrumentalist and producer. Carson was inducted into the Nashville Songwriters Hall of Fame in 1997.

name: David Carron
comments: Rock music singer- songwriter and musician

name: Bob Crewe
comments: Pop artist, songwriter, producer and manager.  He was inducted into the Songwriters Hall of Fame in 1995.

name: Bob Gaudio
comments: Singer, songwriter, and record producer who was inducted into the Songwriters Hall of Fame in 1995

name: John Hurley
comments: Known best as a songwriter, Hurley also released several albums in the 1970s

name: Dimitri Tiomkin
comments: Born in a portion of the Ukraine that was then part of the Russian Empire, Tiomkin left the country after the Russian revolution as the revolution had not been good for the careers of classical pianists. Tiomkin ultimately ended up in Hollywood where he composed scores for over 150 films, winning four Academy Awards for his work.

name: Ned Washington
comments: Songwriter born in Scranton, Pennsylvania He was inducted into the Songwriters Hall of Fame in 1972.

name: Anthony Newley
comments: Actor, singer and songwriter. Songwriting alias derived from the London borough where Newley was born (Hackney). He was inducted into the Songwriters Hall of Fame in 1989.

name: Leslie Bricusse
comments: Composer, lyricist and playwright, who was inducted into the Songwriters Hall of Fame in 1989

name: Rudolf Schenker
comments: Guitarist, songwriter and bandleader from Sarstedt, near Hildesheim, Lower Saxony. In 1965 he founded a rock band called Nameless, which became the Scorpions after a while.

name: Klaus Meine
comments: Lead singer (front man) and occasional rhythm guitarist of the German hard rock/heavy metal band Scorpions.

name: Jack Bruce
comments: Vocalist, songwriter and multi-instrumentalist who was best known as a bass player.  Bruce made his name playing hard rock in the power trio Cream and he played in power trios throughout his career.  Bruce also played and recorded jazz.

name: Lord Kitchener
aliases: Aldwin Roberts with His Steel Band Chorus Boys
Lord Kitchener with The RCA All Star Recording Orch.
comments: "The grand master of calypso" and "the greatest calypsonian of the post-war age."

name: Bob Martin [FR]
comments: Singer, who recorded often with Christiane Legrand for Barclay

name: Jean Fredenucci
comments: Garage rock singer, songwriter, producer and painter

name: Seu Jorge
comments: Musician, singer/songwriter and actor, born in Belford Roxo

name: Jimmie Crane
comments: Song writer from Providence, Rhode Island

name: Dave Travis
aliases: Dave Travis with The Bad River Band
comments: Accomplished country and rockabilly guitarist and singer

name: Bizzy Bone
comments: Member of the rap group, Bone Thugs-n-Harmony (1993-2003, 2008-...)

name: Aerle Taree Jones
comments: Writer, author, publisher and two time Grammy award winning co-writer

name: Claude Joseph Rouget de Lisle
comments: Army officer of the French Revolutionary Wars. He is known for writing the words and music of the "Chant de guerre pour l'armée du Rhin" in 1792, which would later be known as "La Marseillaise" and become the French national anthem

name: Ed Townsend
comments: Soul singer, songwriter, producer and record label owner

name: Robert Gall
comments: Lyricist, who wrote songs for among others, Charles Aznavour and Edith Piaf.

name: Frankie Trumbauer
aliases: Benny Meroff and His Orchestra [Frankie Trumbauer]
Sioux City Six - Under direction of Frank Trumbauer
comments: Jazz saxophonist born in Carbondale, Illinois,  specializing in the C Melody saxophone.

name: Don Read
comments: Lyricist specializing in setting words to classical instrumental pieces

name: Vanessa Chinitor
comments: From Dendermonde, was discovered by John Terra as finalist of the 1996 edition of VTM's "Ontdek De Ster Show". She represented Belgium at the 1999 Eurosong Festival with "Like the Wind", where she ended 12th.

name: The Business
comments: Classic Oi-Punk band from South London.

name: Micky Fitz
comments: Punk rock singer. Founder and lead vocalist of The Business.

name: Dick Williams
comments: Singer and actor who started out in The Williams Brothers

name: Chuck Sagle
aliases: Carl Stevens, His Trumpet and His Orchestra
comments: Trumpet player, arranger and conductor of space age pop. He became an A&R man for Reprise Records in 1962.

name: Teresa Stratas
comments: Operatic soprano from Toronto (of Greek descent)

name: Bret Lunsford
comments: Guitarist, songwriter, singer, author and historian

name: Sam Watters
comments: Songwriter, record producer, singer, and record executive

name: Louis Biancaniello
comments: R&B, dance, pop rock, soul music songwriter, record producer, and musician

name: Dock Boggs
comments: Influential folk singer and banjo player born in West Norton, Virginia

name: Sarah Ogan Gunning
comments: Gunning was a folksinger and songwriter.  Born in Kentucky as a coal miner's daughter, Gunning became a coal miner's wife. After World War II her second husband - her first husband died of tuberculosis  in 1938 - moved to Detroit in search of industrial employment.  In the 1960s, Gunning began to appear at folk festivals; however, after the death of her second husband in 1976, her health deteriorated and she rarely performed outside of church.

name: Jimmy Ricks
aliases: Jimmy Ricks and The Ravens III
Jimmy Ricks with Chorus and Orchestra
comments: Jimmy Ricks was the founder of The Ravens. He sang bass and lead with them from 1946 to 1956.

name: Trey Lorenz
comments: R&B vocalist and songwriter originally from South Carolina.

name: Chris Gaffney
aliases: Chris Gaffney and The Cold Hard Facts
Chris Gaffney & The Cold Hard Facts
comments: Roots music singer-songwriter, accordionist and guitarist

name: Mark Kross
comments: Jazz pianist and composer. His trio was formed in 1988.

name: Len Cariou
comments: Actor, best known for his Tony Award-winning performances in the stage musicals "Applause", "A Little Night Music" and "Sweeney Todd".

name: Edmund Lyndeck
comments: Actor best known for roles in musical theatre, who has also done work in television and as a voiceover artist

name: Tara Morice
comments: Stage and film actress, singer, and dancer

name: Russell Malone
comments: Principally a swing jazz guitarist, he also played in the bebop and contemporary jazz genres.

name: Hazeldine
comments: Alternative country band based in Albuquerque, New Mexico. Members:  Shawn Barton, Tonya Lamm,  Jeffrey Richards and Anne Tkach.

name: Deborah Conway
comments: Singer-songwriter and guitarist, had a career as a model and actress.

name: Chocolate Dandies
comments: One of several jazz bands with the same name. This small group was led by Don Redman and shared some members with McKinney's Cotton Pickers.  Benny Carter succeded Redman as leader.

name: Alceo Guatelli

name: Greg Fitzgerald
comments: Songwriter, musician, engineer and record producer

name: Penny Els
comments: Former editor for magazine "Joepie", main TV-redactor and pioneer for VTM and lyricist

name: Hootenanny Singers
comments: Very successful folk band in the 1960 and 70s. Besides performing own material, they covered and adapted US singer/songwriter hits as well as songs by Swedish troubadours. Björn Ulvaeus still recorded and toured with the band after ABBA had become stars. The group stopped going in 1974, but was active again 1979-1982 with only two of the original members in the line-up.

name: Jennell Hawkins
comments: R&B singer, active in the second half of the 1950s and the first half of the 1960s.

name: Laurie Lingo and The Dipsticks
comments: The two members of Laurie Lingo and The Dipsticks were BBC Radio 1 disc jockeys Paul Burnett and Dave Lee Travis.

name: Britny Fox
comments: Hair / Glam Metal band from Philadelphia, Pennsylvania

name: John David [GB]
comments: Welsh multi-hit producer, songwriter and musician

name: Olga
comments: Punk rock guitarist, singer, songwriter and record producer.

name: Hans Peter Janssens
comments: Baritone singer; Janssens is a stage actor in musical productions, including in London, where in different productions of Les Misérables, he played Jean Valjean and Javert, respectively.

name: Alan Rush
comments: Songwriter, musician, singer, engineer and producer

name: Vittorio De Sica
personal_name: Vittorio Domenico Stanislao Gaetano Sorano De Sica
comments: Director, actor and singer. A leading figure in the neorealist cinema and the Commedia all'Italiana genre.

name: Fred Buscaglione
aliases: Fred Buscaglione e i suoi Asternovas
comments: Singer, songwriter and actor. For his persona, he drew inspiration from the stereotypical Italian-American gangster's loves and passions (mustache, elegant suits, beautiful women, cigarettes, whisky, fast cars...) parodied to comedic effect.

name: Jacksoul
comments: Soul act fronted by Haydain Neale (September 3, 1970 – November 22, 2009).

name: Six Hits and a Miss
aliases: Six Hits and a Miss with Their Ochestra
comments: Vocal group with many credited and uncredited movie appearances. The name of the group changed as members were added or left. They were formed in 1936 as 'Three Hits and a Miss'. By the early 1950s they were known as 'Four Hits and a Miss'.

name: Promises Pit Orchestra
comments: Orchestra from the original production of the stage musical, Promises, Promises

name: Donna McKechnie
comments: Musical theater dancer, singer, actress and choreographer, originally from Pontiac, Michigan

name: Catherine Spaak
comments: French-Italian actress, singer and television presenter. An iconic figure in the "Commedia all'italiana" of the 1960's, she was often cast as a "Lolita" type role. As a singer, she was initially promoted as the "Italian Françoise Hardy ". Spaak has also starred in several TV movies and theatre plays. Since the early 1980's, she has been mainly active as a television presenter.

name: Pietro Garinei
comments: Playwright, actor, and songwriter, mostly known for his joint work with Sandro Giovannini. His brother Enzo is a famous character actor and voice actor.

name: Sandro Giovannini
comments: Playwright. The duo "Garinei e Giovannini" wrote some of the most successful Italian musical comedies.

name: The Heart Attacks
comments: Punk Rock band from Atlanta, Georgia

name: Chris Aron
aliases: Chris Aron & His Good Mood Band

name: Debbie Davies
comments: Electric blues guitarist, singer and songwriter

name: Kristine Sparkle
comments: Singer who recorded 7 solo singles between 1964-1971 and had appeared as a presenter on the BBC children's show "Crackerjack" in 1966-69. Her stage name at that time was Kristine Sparkle, under which she recorded 5 singles and an album for the Decca label. She went on to co-write and record "Devil Woman" with Terry Britten, which became a 1976 top 10 hit for Cliff Richard.

name: The Royal Showband
aliases: Brendan Bowyer and The Royal Showband, Waterford
Brendan Bowyer and The Royal Showband Waterford
Brendan Bowyer with The Royal Showband
Brendan Bowyer with The Royal Showband, Waterford
Charlie Mathews and The Royal Showband, Waterford
The Royal Showband (Waterford) Featuring Brendan Bowyer
The Royal Showband, Waterford (featuring Brendan Bowyer)
The Royal Showband Waterford (Featuring Brendan Bowyer)
The Royal Showband, Waterford (featuring Tom Dunphy)
comments: Irish showband formed in 1957. The original members were Brendan Bowyer [trombone], Michael Coppinger [accordion, saxophone], Jim Conlon [banjo, guitar], Tom Dunphy [bass], Gerry Cullen [keyboards] and Charlie Matthews [drums].

name: Gigi Gryce
aliases: Gigi Gryce and The Jazz Lab Quintet
comments: Jazz woodwind instrumentalist best know for his alto sax work. He was also a composer, arranger and educator.

name: Magnet [1]
comments: Singer, guitarist and songwriter from Askøy near Bergen.

name: Antonia Apodaca
comments: Singer and songwriter known for her performances of traditional New Mexico music

name: Big Smith
comments: Ozarks bluegrass band from Springfield, Missouri

name: Isis
comments: Slude, post-metal band from Los Angeles

name: Robin McKelle
comments: Jazz and soul vocalist and songwriter

name: Grass Routes
comments: Five-piece bluegrass band from central Connecticut.

name: Karrin Allyson
comments: Jazz vocalist and pianist. Allyson sings in several languages as well as scat and vocalese.

name: The Jaywalkers
comments: Band mainly active in the mid to end 1980s. So far only one Mini LP known to us.

name: Eric B. & Rakim
comments: Hip hop duo from Long Island, New York, composed of DJ Eric B. and MC Rakim.

name: Dazz Band
comments: Cleveland-based funk group, formed by Bobby Harris in the late 1970s.

name: Jamie Hince
comments: Guitarist, singer and songwriter. He is married to worldfamous model Kate Moss since 7 August 2010.

name: Blues Plus
comments: UK based blues trio featuring Ian Wroe, Adrian Ingram and Chris Smith.

name: Sly & Robbie
comments: Best known recording reggae rhythm section and production duo. As performing and recording artists active in their own rights and for/with most reggae greats, but also Mick Jagger, Bob Dylan, Joe Cocker, Sinead O'Connor, Yoko Ono, Grace Jones and lots more. Sly & Robbie run their own label, Taxi, and are looking back on 14 Grammy nominations and some wins.

name: Wornell Jones
comments: Pop and R&B singer-songwriter, musician and producer.

name: The Boundary Water Boys
comments: Traditional and roots music instrumental band.

name: Secret Machines
comments: Rock band formed in Dallas, Texas

name: Ricardo Montalbán
comments: Actor, best known for the character 'Armando' in the 'Planet of the Apes' film series and for the character 'Mr. Roarke' on the television series 'Fantasy Island'

name: Gino Washington
comments: R&B singer from from Detroit, Michigan

name: The Rochelles
comments: R&B vocal girl group from Detroit, Michigan, active in the first half of the 1960s

name: The Atlantics [AU]
comments: Instrumental surf and garage rock band from Sydney

name: Elvie Thomas
comments: Blues guitarist and singer from Houston.

name: Keziah Jones
comments: Singer, songwriter and guitarist who describes his musical style as "Blufunk" (a fusion between blues elements and hard-edged funk).

name: Tommy McLain
comments: Swamp pop musician, best known as a singer but who also plays keyboards, drums, bass guitar, fiddle and bagpipe.

name: Florence Véran
comments: Mainly known as a songwriter, pianist Véran also recorded as a singer in the second half of the 1950s and the early 1960s

name: Ba Cissoko
comments: The band is named after the lead singer and electronical Kora player, Ba Cissoko. Members: Kemintan (Ba) Cissoko: lead vocal, Kora, tamani Sekou Kouyaté: kora (acoustical and electrical), vocal Kourou Kouyaté: bass, bolon, vocal Ibrahima Bah "Kounkouré": calebasse, djembé, crin, congas

name: Lama Berry
comments: Lyricist and Ba Cissoko's African band manager

name: Deke Dickerson
comments: Alternative Rockabilly etc. singer/songwriter and guitarist. Originally from Missouri, he moved to LA in 1991. Also a columnist for the "Guitar Player" and "Vintage Guitar" magazines.

name: Lucille Starr
comments: A country music performer from Manitoba, she has recorded solo and with her husband, Bob Regan, as The Canadian Sweethearts.

name: Nathaniel Mayer
aliases: Nathaniel Mayer and The Fabulous Twilights
Nathaniel Mayer and His Fabulous Twilights
comments: R&B singer from Detroit.  After a brief career in the 1960s, Mayer dropped out of music for 35 years, re-emerging in 2002.

name: Devora Brown
comments: Producer, arranger and songwriter, who co-owned the small Detroit labels Fortune and Hi-Q with husband Jack Brown.

name: Richard Seff
comments: Singer, songwriter, writer and music producer

name: Jacques van Tol
comments: Van Tol was during his lifetime one of the most prolific lyricists and songwriters of The Netherlands. Most of his work was published under aliases or the names of the performing artists were used. During the German occupation of The Netherlands in the Second World War he collaborated and wrote many Nazi propanganda songs, but also songs like "Als op het Leidseplein de lichtjes weer eens branden gaan" which were immensely popular. After the war he was imprisoned for three years and put on a blacklist, but still kept writing under various aliases until his death.

name: Dakota [DE]
comments: German-American progressive house DJ and music producer based in Miami, Florida.

name: Jiva [US1]
comments: Members: Sam Wagner, Marc Hutzell Based in Washington, DC

name: Le Vainquere
comments: Amateur musician who participated in a fan trinute album for Jesus and Mary Chain

name: Sea Level
comments: Southern rock/funk/fusion jam band that mixed jazz, blues and rock and existed between 1976 and 1981. Initially it was an offshoot of The Allman Brothers Band, but as tensions grew between the loss of two of its founding members and personal grievances between Gregg Allman and other band mates and associates, Sea Level took on a life of its own as an independent band.

name: Arthur Greenslade
aliases: The Leading Figures directed by Art Greenslade
The Mexicans directed by Arthur Greenslade

name: Sir Henry and His Butlers
comments: Mainly a cover band that only recorded very few own songs.

name: Steve Hoffman
aliases: Lancelot Link and the Evolution Revolution

name: Mickey Lee Lane
comments: Singer, songwriter, arranger, and recording engineer.

name: John Linde
comments: Drummer and songwriter from Oceanside, New York

name: Stan Foster [US1]
comments: Arranger, songwriter and musical director mostly known for his work in the UK in the 1950s and 1960s. A longtime collaborator of Alma Cogan.

name: Lost Goat
comments: San Francisco-based trio of Erica Stoltz (bass, vocals), Eric Peterson (guitar, vocals) and Tina Gordon (drums)

name: Glenn Kaiser
comments: Christian blues musician, singer-songwriter and pastor from Chicago

name: Darrell Mansfield
comments: Vocalist, harmonica player and songwriter, active since 1974. Mansfield is considered a pioneer of the Jesus Music movement of the 1970s and has influenced countless contemporary Christian music and mainstream artists alike.

name: Serious Drinking
comments: Humorous punk rock band from Norwich, England whose lyrical themes often covered football and drinking.

name: Bleach [GB]
comments: Indie rock band from Ipswich, England, usually considered part of the shoegazing genre. The band was formed in 1989 by brothers Neil and Nick Singleton (guitar and bass, respectively) together with drummer Steve Scott and vocalist Salli Carson.

name: Glenn Osser
comments: Arranger, conductor and songwriter born in Munising, Michigan

name: Alan Freed
aliases: Alan Freed and His Rock 'n' Roll Band
comments: Radio disc jockey and promoter. Credited for introducing the phrase "rock and roll" on mainstream radio in the early 1950s and appearing in a number of pioneering rock and roll motion pictures in the second half of the 1950s. His career was destroyed by the payola scandal that hit the broadcasting industry in the early 1960s. Occasionally, he used the name of his second wife, Jacqueline McCoy, as an alias when copyrighting songs.

name: Marvin Holmes
comments: Guitarist, songwriter, producer, and label owner from Oakland, California

name: Troy Cassar-Daley
comments: Country musician from New South Wales

name: Richard Clapton
comments: Singer-songwriter, producer and guitarist from Sydney

name: The Delltones
comments: Rock 'n' roll band, formed in 1958. Active until 1973, the band reformed in 1978.

name: Archie Roach
comments: Singer, songwriter, guitarist, a Gunditjmara and Bundjalung elder and a campaigner for the rights of Indigenous Australians. His wife and musical partner was the singer Ruby Hunter.

name: Oakley Hall
comments: American folk rock band based in Brooklyn, New York.

name: The Woggles
comments: Garage rock band from Atlanta, Georgia.

name: The Olympic Symphonium
comments: Indie folk trio from Fredericton, New Brunswick

name: The Lassie Foundation
comments: Noise pop/dream pop band from Los Angeles

name: The Scientists
comments: Post-punk band from Perth, Australia. The band had two primary incarnations: the Perth-based punk band of the late 1970s and the Sydney/London-based swamp rock band of the 1980s.

name: The Orchids [US3]
comments: All-female pop/rock band featuring Che Zuro, Jan King, Laurie Bell, Laurie McAllister and Sunbie Sinn.

name: Brookville
comments: New York City based band around front man Andy Chase. At the end of 2012, Brookville changed itsname to Camera2.

name: The Bats [NZ]
comments: Four piece band from Christchurch; formed in 1982.

name: Future Pilot A.K.A.
comments: Music that blends classic indie pop with Indian classical, dub and hip hop influences

name: The Wayfarers [US3]
comments: Mid-80s band from New York City

name: Paul Brown [US1]
comments: Contemporary jazz guitarist, songwriter and producer born in Los Angeles

name: Jeff Mironov
comments: Guitarist known for his extensive session work.

name: Randy Brecker
comments: Trumpeter and flugelhorn player from Philadelphia, Pennsylvania.

name: Joey DeFrancesco
comments: Jazz musician best known as a Hammond B3 organ virtuoso. He was also a trumpeter and singer.

name: Taylor Hicks
comments: Singer-songwriter who was the winner of the fifth season of TV talent show "American Idol" in 2006

name: Downtown
comments: Short-lived synth pop / euro dance group from the late 1980's.

name: Plummet
comments: Trance duo, consisting of DJ and producer Eric B. Muniz and singer Nikki (Cheramy Burgess)

name: Dario Fo
comments: Satirist, playwright, theater director, actor and composer. He received the Nobel Prize in Literature in 1997.

name: Jonathan Butler
comments: Born and raised in Cape Town, currently UK-based rhythm and blues, jazz fusion and contemporary worship singer, guitarist and songwriter

name: African Underground All-Stars
comments: Collective of African artists with a.o. Chosan  , Optimus and Iyoka Iyeoka

name: Waldemar Bastos
personal_name: Waldemar dos Santos Alonso de Almeida Bastos
comments: Musician combining Afropop, Portuguese fado and Brazilian influences

name: Randy Thomas
comments: Christian rock guitarist, singer and songwriter, best known for writing "Butterfly Kisses".

name: Bob Carlisle
comments: Contemporary Christian singer and songwriter, best known for his hit song "Butterfly Kisses"

name: The Destructors
comments: Punk rock band from Peterborough, 1977–1984, reformed as Destructors 666 in 2006 and then changed to The Destructors in 2009.

name: Marquis de Sade
comments: New Wave and Post-Punk group formed in Rennes

name: Richard Bargel
comments: German singer and slide blues guitarist, also author, composer, actor and voice actor.

name: Octobre
comments: New Wave and Post-Punk group formed in Rennes

name: Perspective Nevski
comments: New-wave band. Members: Christian de Vardes (vocals), Harman de Salza (electroniqcs), Bertrand Damien (bass),  Illianova E. Karianska (keyboards)

name: The Revelators [AU]
comments: Blues Rock. Core members are Joe Camilleri, James Black & Joe Creighton.

name: Bob Paisley
aliases: Bob Paisley and The Southern Grass

name: Curley Bridges
comments: Rhythm and blues singer, pianist and songwriter

name: Jeb Stuart
comments: Journeyman R&B singer and songwriter. Over time Stuart would record for a host of Memphis labels.

name: Buddy Killen
comments: Producer, composer and music publisher from Alabama

name: Nicole & Hugo
comments: Duo consisting of Nicole Van Palm and Hugo Verbraeken

name: Revolution 409
comments: Members - Steve McDonald, Jeff McDonald, Robert Hecker

name: Celebrity Skin
comments: American alternative rock glam band from Los Angeles, California.

name: Algebra Suicide
comments: Starting in Chicago, Illinois, the combination of Lydia Tomkiw's poetry, mostly presented with in deadpan voice, and Don Hedeker's minimal post-punk-influenced guitar with added drum machine and keyboard sequencing. They toured Europe twice with added slide projections on stage. After parting, Don started The Polcaholics. Lydia released one solo album with various collaborators before she began concentrating on writing.

name: Piero Vivarelli
comments: Director, screenwriter and lyricist. For his films, he sometimes worked under the pseudonym Donald Murray.

name: Lucio Fulci
comments: Influential director and screenwriter, known in particular for his gore and giallo films. Fulci was also an actor and a lyricist.

name: Totò Savio
comments: Composer, lyricist, producer, guitarist and occasional singer

name: Alberto Carisch
comments: Record producer, label owner and lyricist

name: Kajagoogoo
comments: Formed in 1979 as Art Nouveau, the band went pop, added Peter Hamill and changed their name to Kajagoogoo in 1981.

name: Nick Beggs
comments: Bass guitarist and Chapman Stick player.

name: The Daylights [US2]
comments: Alternative band feat. Josh Arnold, Mike "Basil" Ternyik, Ryan Schmidt, Scott Chapin

name: Mark Gray
comments: Country and pop singer, songwriter and composer

name: Miguel Wiels
comments: Musician (pianist), songwriter, composer and record producer

name: Free Souffriau
comments: Singer and actress, most known for her role as "Mega Mindy".

name: Tante Leen
comments: Singer from Amsterdam. Together with her partner Johnny Jordaan, the two together hold the title of "de Beste Stem van de Jordaan" ("The best voice of the Jordaan").

name: Jaap Valkhoff
aliases: Slome Japie en de Zingende Katers
comments: Musician, singer , accordionist , saxophonist , composer and lyricist. He was a pioneer of Dutch jazz and In the years around World War II he composed songs as "Denk jij nog aan dien tijd" en "Diep in mijn hart". After the war Valkhoff had his own orchestra and his theme song was the song "Ik ben Japie de portier". His most famous text he wrote in 1961: "Hand in hand, kameraden", the anthem of Rotterdam soccer club Feyenoord.

name: Gulli Gudmundsson
comments: Bass player, composer and bandleader born in Iceland in 1971. Moved to the Netherlands in 1993.

name: Kristi Rose
aliases: Kristi Rose and the Midnight Walkers

name: Albert Kuvezin
comments: Tuvan throat singer, guitarist and yat-kha (long zither) player

name: Wess
comments: Singer and bass guitarist, who moved to Italy in the 1960s in pursuit of a musical career, where he became very successful.

name: Walter Beasley [US1]
comments: Alto and soprano saxophonist, singer, composer, producer and record label owner

name: Osaka Popstar and the American Legends of Punk
Andrea Lo Vecchio
comments: Singer, composer, lyricist and music producer

name: The Little Red School House Chorus
Alan Gill
comments: Guitarist and songwriter from Liverpool (UK). In 1977 he founded Dalek I. He joined The Teardrop Explodes in July 1980 and co-wrote their single "Reward" but he left them already in 1981 to concentrate on his own band Dalek I. In 1985 he founded the label Bopadub which was releasing cassette compilations.

name: The Bravery
comments: Alternative rock band from New York

name: Gilles
comments: Poet, author, chansonnier, comedian and composer

name: Jane Olivor
comments: Cabaret singer. After releasing five albums from the late 1970s through the early 1980s, her stage fright, anxieties over her rapid success, and her husband's illness and death caused her to take a 10-year hiatus from her career. Reviving her performing and recording career in the early 1990s, she released five more albums from 1995 through 2004. Since 2009, she has been retired from the public eye.

name: John Schroeder [GB]
comments: Easy listening composer, conductor, producer and arranger

name: Bebu Silvetti
comments: Argentine-born Mexican pianist, composer, conductor, arranger and record producer. In the 1970s he moved to Mexico and got Mexican nationality.

name: Rosenstolz
comments: Sophisticated pop duo from Berlin looking back on five no. 1 albums and throughout their career awarded many prizes

name: Bang Gang
comments: Project of Barði Jóhannson with other artists.

name: Tsunami
comments: Indie rock band from Arlington, Virginia

name: Ray, Goodman & Brown
comments: With their move away from the Stang label (1979), The Moments were compelled to change their name. The group was renamed using the surnames of their then-current members Harry Ray, Al Goodman and Billy Brown.

name: The Lothars
comments: Theremin band. Their name is based on the earlier Theremin-based band Lothar & The Hand People.

name: Phil Rockrohr
comments: Singer-songwriter and guitarist. His band, The Lifters, was formed in 1999

name: Dan McMillion
aliases: Dan McMillion & The Groovin' High Big Band
comments: Florida-based jazz trumpeter and orchestra leader

name: Gene Wooten
comments: Dobro player and multi-instrumentalist. Session musician and a regular on The Grand Ole Opry since the late 1970s.

name: Melissa Ellen
comments: Atlanta-based singer, songwriter and vocal coach

name: Undertow
comments: A straight edge hardcore band from Seattle, Washington, active during the early and mid-1990s.

name: Groundwork
comments: A political hardcore band from Tuscon, AZ.

name: Outspoken
comments: Hardcore band from Huntington Beach, CA

name: Ashes [US]
comments: 1990s emo / hardcore style band from Bethesda, Maryland

name: Peplab
comments: Quartet, whose members have been part of Doop, Hocus Pocus, Sponk (Ridderhof + Garnefski), and Capricorn (Weekhout), now join up to make electro-disco-rock.

name: Peter Garnefski
comments: Producer, musician. Uses Qbrick as an alias.

name: Ferry Ridderhof
comments: Electronic music producer. teacher,  owner of Proudly Recording Studio’s and of the labels Mr. Cheng’s Quality Tunes and Proudly Recording. Member of a lot of music groups like Boobytrax, Boombastic, Doop, Ferry & Garnefski, Headcracker, Hocus Pocus, Hof N Hans, Igor, Krimson, Madam, Mandroid, Peplab, Rare Candy, Rietveld, Sebastian Blender, Sponk, Sugar 'N' Spice, Thick Red Spot, Toxit, Vicious Delicious, Waxattack, X-Orgasmic

name: Wizzard
comments: English glam rock band formed by Roy Wood, former member of The Move and co-founder of the Electric Light Orchestra. The band is most famous for their 1973 UK #4 Christmas song "I Wish It Could Be Christmas Everyday", which is played during every Christmas season in the UK since its release.

name: Subway Sect
comments: Punk/post punk band from 1976 to 1982, 2002 through to present

name: Kimberley Walsh
comments: Singer, songwriter, actress and TV presenter

name: The Bird and the Bee
comments: Indie synth-pop duo from Los Angeles, California

name: Gary Unwin
comments: Songwriter, who co-authored some "Sound-of-Munich" disco hits in the late 1970s with his wife Patti Unwin.

name: Patti Unwin
comments: Songwriter, who co-authored some "Sound-of-Munich" disco hits in the late 1970s with her husband Gary Unwin.

name: Karat
comments: Pop/rock band founded and based in Berlin and havung released some huge hits. Their Der blaue Planet is the best selling album by a GDR band.

name: Helmut Richter
comments: Lyricist, journalist, author, guitarist and professor of literature.

name: Richard Wagner
comments: Composer (mainly opulent operas) and conductor. Regarded as one of the most influential classical composers of his time.

name: Gerard Stellaard
comments: Pianist, producer, arranger, and songwriter. Active from 1970 till 2004.

name: Charlie Christian
comments: Jazz guitarist; pioneer of the electric guitar.

name: K.W.S.
comments: Dance-pop trio - Chris King, Winnie Williams and Delroy St. Joesph

name: Michael Kaeshammer
comments: German-born boogie-woogie and traditional jazz pianist

name: J. Harold Murray
comments: A professional singer since childhood, Murray performed in stage and movie musicals primarily in the 1920s.
